1.name: La passion de Jeanne d'Arc
1.description: In 1431, Jeanne d'Arc is placed on trial on charges of heresy. The ecclesiastical jurists attempt to force Jeanne to recant her claims of holy visions.

2.name: The Man Who Laughs
2.description: When a proud noble refuses to kiss the hand of the despotic King James in 1690, he is cruelly executed and his son surgically disfigured.

3.name: The Circus
3.description: The Tramp finds work and the girl of his dreams at a circus.

4.name: The Wind
4.description: A frail young woman from the east moves in with her cousin in the west, where she causes tension within the family and is slowly driven mad.

5.name: Alraune
5.description: A scientist interested in the laws of heredity, impregnates a prostitute in a laboratory with the semen of a hanged murderer. The prostitute conceives a female child who has no concept of love, whom the professor adopts.

6.name: The Law of the Range
6.description: Jim Lockhart is out to capture the robbing and murdering "Solitaire Kid". His girl Betty is on a stagecoach held up by the Kid, who falls for her and who she notices has a tatoo very much ...                See full summary »

7.name: Steamboat Bill, Jr.
7.description: The effete son of a cantankerous riverboat captain comes to join his father's crew.

8.name: The Crowd
8.description: The life of a man and woman together in a large, impersonal metropolis through their hopes, struggles and downfalls.

9.name: Spione
9.description: The mastermind behind a ubiquitous spy operation learns of a dangerous romance between a Russian lady in his employ and a dashing agent from the government's secret service.

10.name: The Cameraman
10.description: Hopelessly in love with a woman working at MGM Studios, a clumsy man attempts to become a motion picture cameraman to be close to the object of his desire.

11.name: Noah's Ark
11.description: The Biblical story of Noah and the Great Flood, with a parallel story of soldiers in the First World War.

12.name: The Docks of New York
12.description: A blue-collar worker on New York's depressed waterfront finds his life changed after he saves a woman attempting suicide.

13.name: The Last Command
13.description: A former Imperial Russian general and cousin of the Czar ends up in Hollywood as an extra in a movie directed by a former revolutionary.

14.name: Speedy
14.description: Harold "Speedy" Swift, a fan of Babe Ruth and the New York Yankees, saves from extinction the city's last horse-drawn trolley, operated by his girlfriend's grandfather.

15.name: Street Angel
15.description: A woman on the run from the law finds her past catching up to her just as she is on the verge of true happiness.

16.name: The Last Warning
16.description: A producer decides to reopen a theater, that had been closed five years previously when one of the actors was murdered during a performance, by staging a production of the same play with ...                See full summary »

17.name: The Farmer's Wife
17.description: After his daughter weds, a middle-aged widower with a profitable farm decides to remarry, but finds choosing a suitable mate a problematic process.

18.name: Easy Virtue
18.description: A recently divorced woman hides her scandalous past from her new husband and his family.

19.name: Our Dancing Daughters
19.description: A flapper who's secretly a good girl and a gold digging floozy masquerading as an ingénue both vie for the hand of a millionaire.

20.name: The Patriot
20.description: In 18th-Century Russia, the Czar, Paul, is surrounded by murderous plots and trusts only Count Pahlen. Pahlen wishes to protect his friend, the mad king, but because of the horror of the ...                See full summary »

21.name: Sadie Thompson
21.description: A prostitute seeking a fresh start becomes the obsession of a religious extremist.

22.name: Abwege
22.description: Neglected by her husband, an ambitious lawyer, Irene seeks variety in Berlin's nightlife, drugs and flirtations included.

23.name: Lonesome
23.description: Two lonely people in the big city meet and enjoy the thrills of an amusement park, only to lose each other in the crowd after spending a great day together. Will they ever see each other again?

24.name: La chute de la maison Usher
24.description: Allan visits the sinister Usher family mansion, where his friend Roderick is painting a portrait of his sickly wife Madeline. The portrait seems to be draining the life out of Madeline, slowly leading to her death.

25.name: 4 Devils
25.description: Four orphans, raised by an aging clown, becomes a high wire act in a circus.

26.name: Champagne
26.description: A spoiled heiress defies her father by running off to marry her lover. However, Daddy has a few tricks up his sleeve.

27.name: Moulin Rouge
27.description: Parysia is the rage of Paris. She has a daughter, secretly engaged to Andre, and the boy's aristocratic father objects to the alliance because of Margaret's mother being a revue artist. ...                See full summary »

28.name: Laugh, Clown, Laugh
28.description: A professional clown and a self-indulgent count learn to help each other with their problems, but then become romantic rivals.

29.name: The Mysterious Lady
29.description: An attractive Russian spy seduces an Austrian officer in order to get some important plans, but when she actually falls in love with him, both of them are placed in a dangerous situation.

30.name: The Godless Girl
30.description: Two teenagers, one an atheist and the other a Christian, fall in love at a brutal reform school.

31.name: West of Zanzibar
31.description: A magician seeks vengeance upon the man who paralyzed him and the illegitimate daughter he sired with the magician's wife.

32.name: Show People
32.description: A young lady from Georgia goes to Hollywood in the hopes of becoming an actress.

33.name: In Old Arizona
33.description: A charming, happy-go-lucky bandit in old Arizona plays cat-and-mouse with the sheriff trying to catch him while he romances a local beauty.

34.name: A Woman of Affairs
34.description: When two childhood sweethearts are kept from marrying, misery ensues.

35.name: The Racket
35.description: An honest police captain vows to bring down a powerful bootlegger who is protected by corrupt politicians and judges.

36.name: L'argent
36.description: The business tycoon Nicolas Saccard is nearly ruined by his rival Gunderman, when he tries to raise capital for his company. To push up the price of his stock, Saccard plans a publicity ...                See full summary »

37.name: White Shadows in the South Seas
37.description: An alcoholic doctor on a Polynesian island, disgusted by white exploitation of the natives, finds himself marooned on a pristinely beautiful island.

38.name: Shooting Stars
38.description: The husband and wife acting team of Mae Feather and Julian Gordon is torn apart when he discovers she is having an affair with the screen comedian Andy Wilks. Mae hatches a plot to kill her...                See full summary »

39.name: The Divine Woman
39.description: [For 9 minute surviving fragment] Lucian, a soldier in Paris, is to ship out for Algiers at 9 that evening. He stops by for a last meal with his love, Marianne. He may be worried that when ...                See full summary »

40.name: The Wedding March
40.description: A young impoverished aristocrat falls in love with an inn-keepers daughter, but has to marry money.

41.name: Potomok Chingis-Khana
41.description: In 1918 a simple Mongolian herdsman escapes to the hills after brawling with a western capitalist fur trader who cheats him. In 1920 he helps the partisans fight for the Soviets against the...                See full summary »

42.name: Geschlecht in Fesseln
42.description: A young man is convicted of manslaughter and sentenced to a term in prison. There he forms a close relationship with his cellmate and upon his release his wife is concerned as to how prison has changed the man she married.

43.name: Beggars of Life
43.description: After killing her treacherous step-father, a girl tries to escape the country with a young vagabond. She dresses as a boy, they hop freight trains, quarrel with a group of hobos, and steal ...                See full summary »

44.name: Tempest
44.description: In Czarist Russia, a peasant officer, resented by the aristocrats, falls in love with a princess.

45.name: Manhattan Cocktail
45.description: Babs and Bob leave their small-town life after graduating from college and go to New York in an effort to make the Broadway big time. Mrs. Renov, the wife of a theatrical producer, develops...                See full summary »

46.name: The River
46.description: A naïve young man is working on a logging camp beside a turbulent river. When it closes for winter, he opts to stay for the experience. He meets a woman who was the girlfriend to the boss ...                See full summary »

47.name: Gentlemen Prefer Blondes
47.description: Gold digging blonde Lorelei and her brunette friend Dorothy are searching for rich husbands.

48.name: Lights of New York
48.description: Two men are conned into bootlegging business.

49.name: The Trail of '98
49.description: Fortune hunters from all over the country rush to the Klondike in 1897 to seek their fortunes in the gold are tested by hardships of the journey.

50.name: The Battle of the Sexes
50.description: Gum-chewing frizzy-haired gold-digger Marie Skinner cooks up a scheme with her lover Babe Winsor, a jazz hound, to fleece a portly, middle-aged real estate tycoon, William Judson. Marie ...                See full summary »
